What the role is
The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) seeks to transform the delivery of Government Digital Services by taking an 'outside-in' view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with the public to co-develop technologies.

Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering.
As an Operations Manager, you will be part of team to manage the Government IT support infrastructures and services. You will manage a team of engineers with strong technical competency to support the Government IT infrastructure and services and ensuring high levels of availability, performance, security and good user experience across the Whole-of-Government (WOG).

What you will be working on:

Operational Management
Management of the team of 24x7 Network Operation Center engineers, including all aspects of people and performance management.
Ensure the overall availability and health of Whole-of-Government (WOG) infrastructure and services.
During high severity incidents with major disruptions to the organization, you will act as an Incident Manager driving ICT service restoration by ensuring all relevant parties are engaged, and stakeholder communications are completed as per defined incident process schedule.
Drive and work with various support teams (internal and external) to resolve service disruptions and restore services as rapidly as possible.
Ensure timely escalation and track incident life cycle till resolution.
Ensure appropriate and timely communications are sent to senior management to update on the incident status and impact.
Prepare weekly executive summaries and statistical reports on high priority incidents and utilization for senior management using data analytics tools.
Document and update NOC operation processes and troubleshooting guides.
Identify areas for process and efficiency improvements within NOC.
Participate and contribute product or enhancement projects.
Plan and involved in Business Continuity Plan.

Resource Management
Evaluates technical skills of the team and ensures there is an appropriate level of expertise.
Review and approve shift-related matters such as staff planning.
Conduct tabletop exercises to maintain proper incident handling and address gaps in the processes.
Perform performance objectives and performance reviews with team members.

What we are looking for:
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science with at least 5 years’ experience in NOC operations, incident and people management.
Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills.
Proficient in Data Analytics tools such as PowerBI and Tableau (Preferred)
In-depth knowledge on Change Management and IT Service Management framework and processes (Certified ITIL v4 preferred)
Experience working with a wide range of enterprise technologies, such as Network Infrastructure, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, PKI, Anti-virus, Disaster Recovery and Video conferencing and Network monitoring systems.
Experience in using Data virtualisation tools like Tableau to develop dashboards.
Good deductive reasoning and problem-solving ability.
Able to work independently and as a good team player.
Open to work on rotating shifts.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is essential to innovation. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s meaningful for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round

As a member of the Enterprise Services (ES) team within the Archives and Enterprises Services (AES) Division, the jobholder will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining the systems and data infrastructure required for efficient and reliable data processing, storage, and analysis. He/she plays a crucial role in building and maintaining the data pipelines and platform that enable NLB to collect, transform and analyse large volumes of data to meet both current and future needs of NLB business services, thereby contributing to the vision and mission of NLB.
What you will be working on
Data Architecture Design: Collaborating with NLB solution architects, Data Management Platform awarded vendor and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and designing scalable and efficient data architectures.
Data Management: Working closely with the vendor to set up and manage Databases and Data Lake, including selecting appropriate database technologies, optimizing query performance, and ensuring data integrity and security.
Data Integration: Working closely with the vendor to integrate data from different sources to create a unified and consistent view of the data for analysis and reporting purposes.
Data Transformation and Manipulation: Working closely with the vendor to perform data transformations, such as masking, aggregations, joins, and filtering, to meet the specific requirements of data analysis and reporting.

What we are looking for
Relevant IT qualifications or equivalent experience with advanced qualifications.
At least 2-5 years of relevant technical working experience with data management, RDBMS and ETL.
Experience in AWS Platform Architecture which includes S3, Data Lake Formation, Glue, Athena, Redshift, Kinesis, etc.
Proficiency in SQL and Python.
Knowledge of the various Data Management Tools such as Databrick, Data pipes and or Snowflake is an advantage.
Knowledge in various data analytics tools like Qlik Sense, Tableau, etc is an advantage.
Able to communicate with all levels to manage relevant stakeholders and a good team player.
The successful applicant will be appointed on a two-year contract. The work location will be at ESR BizPark @ Chai Chee.

What the role is


The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator.

As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector.

As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education.

MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry.

Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape.
What you will be working on
We are currently seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to work on a system transition project. You will play a critical role in assisting with the decommissioning of our legacy system called the Corporate e-Lodgment (“CeL”).  CEL is an eServices platform that enables online submission of licence applications and registrations from applicants who seek to operate fund management companies (“FMCs”), and subsequent lodgments by Registered FMCs to the Monetary Authority of Singapore (“MAS”).
Responsibilities include:
Collaborate with the project team to understand the functionalities and dependencies of the legacy system, CEL.
Assist in the management, coordination and direction of overall processes surrounding the decommissioning and transition of legacy system(s).
Work closely with stakeholders to identify and document the requirements and objectives for the alternative systems.
Maintaining regular touchpoints with stakeholders, documentation of logs and management records
Support the development of a transition plan outlining the migration strategy from CEL to the alternative systems.
Assist in the testing and validation of alternative systems to ensure compatibility and data integrity.
Research, experimentation, and communicating of change to users
Take stock of progress and demonstrate the ability to respond to any new or overlooked requirements 
Provide training and support to end-users on the usage of the alternative systems.
Create and maintain documentation, including user manuals and standard operating procedures, for the alternative systems
What we are looking for
Relevant experience with systems migration is preferred
Good problem solver and team player.
Good communication skills and ability to articulate information (both verbal and written).

Funding and resource management is a strategic lever to direct efforts towards desired changes and to advance digitalisation objectives. Agency: Smart Nation and Digital Government Office
Request Div Text:
What the role is
The Smart Nation and Digital Government Office (SNDGO), under the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO), plans and prioritizes key Smart Nation and digital government projects, raises the standards of Government ICT and services, builds long-term capabilities for the public sector, and promotes adoption and participation in digital and smart innovations. It takes a whole-of-nation effort, and we will actively engage the public, the industry and fellow agencies as we build a Smart Nation together.

The candidate should be passionate about creating impact with technology. The job has 2 main aspects – technology policy, and product management related work. Stakeholder management is also a key aspect of the job, supporting both the policy and product management areas.

Technology policy: The candidate will help to shape and implement WOG policies to better deliver Government-to-Citizen (G2C) and Government-to-Business (G2B) digital services, e.g. reviewing whether certain products should be mandated across WOG, or if there should be further consolidation/proliferation of services at the WOG level. The candidate can also propose and shape how Government can better develop digital utilities and a G2C and G2B technology stack, e.g. whether we should create new digital utilities, how we can get components within this tech stack to work together better to deliver digital services. The candidate will also need to work through legal regulations and policy issues, develop resourcing frameworks and negotiate cross-agency dependencies.

Product management: The candidate will also be expected to drive product management, together with GovTech, for various key Government digital products/services. The Citizen and Business Products teams handle the following G2B and G2C digital products and services, and you will work on one or more of these:

• LifeSG, which aims to bundle together relevant Government services for citizens at significant events and stages of their lives. This will help to provide a more seamless and convenient experience for citizens when transacting with agencies.

• G2C digital products such as customer relationship management solutions, file management solutions, chatbots, and booking solutions.

• The GoBusiness platform, which aims to be a central platform for businesses to transact with the Government. This will help provide businesses with simpler, faster and better experiences when transacting with Government agencies.

• National Digital Identity (NDI) and Singpass. The NDI is a nation-wide digital identity service, which allows for single-sign-on across government and commercial digital services, and facilitates new business models through products such as digital signatures and digital identity wallets.

For the respective products that the candidate oversees, the candidate is expected to drive adoption, review product roadmap, and support the GovTech teams where needed for strong execution and delivery.

Given the dual policy and product management nature of the job, the candidate will work at the cross-section between technology policy and product management, and is not required to develop software or hardware.

Stakeholder management: The role requires working across a wide range of government agencies, including working closely with the development teams in GovTech and other Government organisations such as the Public Service Division to promote deployment and adoption of the various digital products.
What you will be working on
Key Responsibilities

• Help to plan and execute Singapore’s technology policy, strategy and roadmap to improve G2C and/or G2B services.

• Build subject matter expertise and stay up to date on technological developments in G2C and/or G2B digital products.

• Shape the product roadmaps for key G2C and/or G2B digital products, and drive adoption.

• Through service journeys where relevant, design and develop internal and external process improvements across multiple organisations to deliver user-centric services.

• Define and own requirements, milestones, metrics and key performance indicators for G2C and/or G2B digital products adoption.

• Coordinate among different government agencies to ensure smooth execution of tasks and launch of product features.



Key skills you can develop in this role

• Product policy, especially in the Government context, e.g. consolidation vs proliferation of services;

• Product management, guiding and pushing the growth of digital products, alignment to management vision;

• Stakeholder engagement, working across multiple agencies, management of conflicts;

• Understanding of Government ICT landscape
What we are looking for
Preferred Qualifications – Ideal candidate will have many of these skills/experiences. Technical/ICT expertise is not required, but a strong plus.

Policy experience
• Demonstrated success in policy formulation and implementation. Policy experience in non-ICT areas would also be useful, as skills are transferrable.
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
• Strong writing ability, able to clearly articulate a policy position or strategy, and defend one’s views.

ICT experience
• Strong technical experience in ICT areas will be highly preferred.
• 2+ years of experience in product management or working on a product team, or experience with enterprise-grade software development in the private or public sector.
• Knowledge of cybersecurity is a plus.

Execution
